{"step_by_step_thinking": "Wooden wedges are typically used for splitting wood, securing objects, or for leveling purposes. They come in various shapes depending on their intended use. Triangular wedges are common for splitting wood or for use in construction to level or secure objects. Rectangular wedges can also be used in construction or carpentry. Round wedges, also known as dowels, are commonly used in furniture assembly or carpentry. Therefore, all these types of wooden wedges are commonly available.", "answer_choice": "D"}
